decisions.title: LLMPirate: LLMs for Black-box Hardware IP Piracy
decisions.justification: This paper appears to discuss a novel attack technique using LLMs to exploit hardware IP, which directly aligns with the client's interest in LLM security and novel attack techniques.

decisions.justification: This paper discusses adversarial attacks in the physical world, which is relevant to the client's interest in machine learning security and attack techniques.

decisions.title: Exploiting Watermark-Based Defense Mechanisms in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models for Unauthorized Data Usage
decisions.justification: This paper explores ways to exploit watermark defenses in ML models, which aligns with the client's interest in ML security and attack techniques.

decisions.title: Towards Robust Evaluation of Unlearning in LLMs via Data Transformations
decisions.justification: This paper appears to discuss security aspects of LLM unlearning, which is relevant to the client's interest in LLM security.

decisions.title: Creating Scalable AGI: the Open General Intelligence Framework
decisions.justification: This appears to be a general AI architecture paper without specific focus on security or attack techniques.

description:
I am a cyber security researcher. I enjoy reading about novel attack techniques, 
particularly in the following categories:
- LLM security
- Machine learning security

I am not particularly interested in general hype around machine learning, AI, or 
LLMs. I am especially interested in specific attack techniques or attack vectors 
that threat actors could potentially use to exploit LLMs, neural networks, and other 
machine learning models. I am looking for highly technical information on new 
techniques or tools. 

My goals are to learn more about AI security and how to build applications that use 
AI securely.
